criteria.name: Identification and Order of Steps
criteria.description: Clearly lists all four major steps (segmentation, targeting, differentiation, positioning) in correct order.

scoringLevels.full: Lists all four steps in the correct order.
scoringLevels.partial: Lists three steps or has them out of order.
scoringLevels.minimal: Lists fewer than three steps or omits key terminology.

criteria.name: Explanation of Steps
criteria.description: Provides accurate, concise explanations of each step, aligned with textbook definitions.

scoringLevels.full: Explanations are accurate, clear, and concise.
scoringLevels.partial: Explanations are mostly accurate but lack detail or depth.
scoringLevels.minimal: Explanations are vague or contain inaccuracies.

criteria.name: Understanding the Goals of the Steps
criteria.description: Clearly explains what the company seeks to achieve in the first two steps (selecting customers) versus the last two (creating value proposition).

scoringLevels.full: Explanation is clear and aligns with course concepts.
scoringLevels.partial: Explanation is somewhat clear but lacks connection to course material.

criteria.name: Clarity and Organization
criteria.description: Response is well-structured, logical, and free from errors in grammar or spelling.

scoringLevels.full: Response is clear, well-organized, and error-free.
scoringLevels.partial: Response has minor organization or grammar issues.
scoringLevels.minimal: Response is poorly organized or difficult to follow.
